means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 巴尼斯特 Bannister的变体

sentence.Network_en: She grasped hold of the banister to support herself.
sentence.Network_cn: 她抓住楼梯扶手以支撑住自己的身体.

sentence.Network_en: The boys amused themselves by sliding down the banister.
sentence.Network_cn: 男孩们从楼梯扶手滑下以取乐.

sentence.Network_en: He arched over the banister to grab her hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 他拱起身子越过栏杆去抓她的手.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 经典英文电影短语 - 豆丁网 ... Christ Almighty( 万能的主)； 1. banister( 楼梯扶手); haunted(  闹鬼的).
GRE 词汇表(红宝书) - 豆丁网 ... baneful adj. 有害的,致祸的 banister n. (楼梯的)栏杆 bankrupt adj. 破产的.
Bangor ladder 消防摇梯banister 栏杆柱；栏杆；楼梯扶手banjo case 井口喷气减速装置
新东方GRE词汇 - 豆丁网 ... banish ? vt. 驱逐 banister n. 栏杆的支柱,楼梯的扶栏 banquet n. 盛宴.

list.abs: she leaned over the banister .她斜靠在栏杆上.
armrest : wooden banisters is most common , feel is more a few more comfortable also .扶手：木制扶手最为常见，手感也更为舒适一些。
banian 宽大衬衣banister brush 软毛刷banjo frame 曲线规

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from earlier barrister, alteration of baluster

entry.def: A banister is a rail supported by posts and fixed along the side of a staircase. The plural banisters can be used to refer to one of these rails.

example.ex: I still remember sliding down the banisters.
example.tran: 我仍然记得从栏杆上滑下来的事。

means.word_mean: 1. a railing at the side of a staircase or balcony to prevent people from falling
